intro: Orobus ohwianus, commonly known as the Ohwia's orobus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and distinctive pod fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate to subtropical climates. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Orobus ohwianus is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
